alert.note: Alert for Burke; Columbia; McDuffie; Richmond (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 07 at 6:46PM EDT until July 07 at 8:30PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of east central Georgia and central South Carolina, including the following counties, in east central Georgia, Burke, Columbia, McDuffie and Richmond. In central South Carolina, Aiken, Barnwell and Orangeburg. * WHEN...Until 745 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 646 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Aiken, Aiken Mall, Savannah River Site, Hephzibah, Williston, New Ellenton, Jackson, Gloverville, Augusta Regional Airport, McBean, Citizens Park, South Augusta, Aiken State Park, Blythe, Springfield, Keysville, Windsor, Audubon`s Silver Bluff Sanctuary and Savannah River Site Badge Office. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 520 in Georgia between mile markers 7 and 14. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Most flooding deaths occur in vehicles. Never drive through a flooded roadway or around barricades. Turn around, don`t drown. Report any flooding directly to the Columbia National Weather Service at 803 234 4115 when it is safe to do so. You can also send reports by Facebook or Twitter to NWSColumbia or by e-mail at NWS.Columbia@noaa.gov.
